details.description: "SipCha is a place that serves bubble tea, rolled ice creams and other tea base products. We take pride on offering the best ingredients and freshest ingredients to our customers from serving the freshest fruit tea to be best selection of teas. We also make our ice cream fresh everyday. One of the best important part is we are a small locally owe business. It has a very nice sit down environment for people to relax and chat."

raw_data.name: SipCha
raw_data.full_address: 2041 South Blvd Suite 105B, Charlotte, NC 28203, United States

popular_times.title: Usually as busy as it gets
Usually as busy as it gets

raw_data.description: "SipCha is a place that serves bubble tea, rolled ice creams and other tea base products. We take pride on offering the best ingredients and freshest ingredients to our customers from serving the freshest fruit tea to be best selection of teas. We also make our ice cream fresh everyday. One of the best important part is we are a small locally owe business. It has a very nice sit down environment for people to relax and chat."

posts.body: Stay Tune! Labubu Pudding/Topping Coming soon!!

reviews_data.review_text: I am disappointed with my experience at Sipcha :(. We waited over 20 minutes for two drinks. I got a Chai Milk Tea & Strawberry Matcha and we were both very disappointed. We didn’t get toppings but I feel like that shouldn’t be an issue when ordering. They both tasted very plain and not sweet at all
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hey Tiff, we apologize for your experience. Sorry we do have a little staff shortage right now. Can you send us a email to sipcha@yahoo.com and we would love to make it up to you.

reviews_data.review_text: I usually don't visit these kind of stores. But after getting this purple sweet potato drink, I'll probably be a regular

SipCha is literally the best boba spot in town! Their customer service is top tier. As a picky person, Sarahy did a great job of helping me try new things and figuring out what I like! The lychee jade with mango popping boba and passion fruit jelly is my absolute favorite. The atmosphere is very nice as well, perfect for working/studying!
Favorite boba place in south end. My go to order is a thai iced tea with boba and lychee jelly. Delicious!!
Delicious boba teas and everyone is so friendly and knowledgeable! My fav spot 💕
best boba in charlotte ez

Just walked in after calling ahead to confirm that they were still serving rolled ice cream and was informed by the staff (Brittany) that they do not sell rolled ice cream 30 minutes prior to closing, even though I was told on the phone otherwise. Last week it was the same issue.
I had a sip cha with bubble added , very nice. Recommended

Looking forward to coming back! The drinks we got were all very well-made and worth coming out to get. The tea flavor is definitely very pleasant and rich, which I really loved since a lot of places can be a bit bland or bitter. The boba was also very good and an added bonus to an already amazing drink. The inside area also had a very nice atmosphere to sit and drink. Quick, clean, and tasty!
Amazing drinks and desserts!

The BEST boba in Charlotte hands down! I'm from the Bay Area, so I do not say this willy nilly. Some drinks can be a bit sweet, but you can ask for 50% sweetness on most drinks. Love this place so much!

First time ordering from this place. It's a nice cozy spot to just come and hang out. One thing that was confusing was that we had to come in through Tours de Jours which is a bakery because there's no signage out in front pointing to SipCha. Regardless there's lots of parking and once you find it through the back/side of the building it's very accessible. I also think it's very affordable as well. Depending on your toppings, it's about $8 per large drink.

Some of the sweet drinks can be a little sweet, and i have mixed feelings about the cups they use, (but they have foam caps — which are excellent— so it makes sense). But they have the best Taro you will ever have. No other boba place has drinks this good and this unique.
Hands down the best and most consistent boba shop!!! Our favorites are the lychee jade and Thai tea. Always tasty and the service is excellent! The mochi waffles are also delicious! 10/10
My favorite boba tea place in Charlotte
When i went there it was soo nice and they were talent at makeing the boba they even showed us the bavk of the restaurant

Since being in the area, I have visited Sipcha 3 times now! I tried something new from my usual Taro or Mango bubble tea. They have one called Strawberry Shortcake. I love it minus the sprinkles.....lol....I will try to come back one more time before I leave. If you like bubble tea, I highly recommend this place!!
It’s literally good every time !! They know me in there :)

Girl didn't have much knowledge of the tapioca balls they put in the boba.....it's all tapioca just diff flavors ..and used to carnation milk instead of the other milk. However, fruit was delicious inside and went well with my Sakura.  Won't be back, she told me you couldn't customize, however they allow you to pick diff toppings etc. Meant to go to Caribou to try their boba, but I think imma stick to asian markets for that treat💜
Delish! It’s a cute tucked away shop near a busy shopping area. The boba was nice and soft; no uncooked bite in the middle. The drinks weren’t too sweet and it was refreshing for the warm weather.
Probably the best boba place in Charlotte
Es un gran lugar, muy buena atención, la mujer atendiendo es muy amable y habla dos idiomas. Tienen opciones saludables y deliciosas. Son mi lugar favorito de boba en Charlotte.
I love this place. Great service, excellent drinks. Let’s keep supporting them & Tous Les Jours next door ☺️
Limited parking in the back of the building. Waffles seem like they are made off-site and served in boxes.
I had such an amazing experience. Everything tastes so good! The girl in glasses was very patient with me since it was my first time. She gave me so many recommendations. Will definitely come again 😊
I only came here bc of all the good reviews. The taro smoothie was a hard pass after one sip and the strawberry shortcake was just meh 😭 it wasn’t good at all .

The staff at the South Blvd. Location is always attentive and friendly. I love that they let me try a topping before I add it to my order if I'm ever nervous about the taste. It's also always very clean and tidy.
They have a very nice earthy palette of milk tea flavors. Place is always clean and the staff is super nice
My favorite place to get milk tea in Charlotte

I got hooked on their drinks at the Cary location. When this one opened, I was saddened that my favorite drink, the Thai Tea Mojito, is not on the menu. It is very clean and being attached to my fav, Tous les Jours, makes this a perfect place to catch respite.

As one with mobility issues, using the accessibility ramp is a chore. I know this is not the fault of SipCha, but I post this as a warning for anyone with disabilities. Park in the front and pray there is parking there. Enter Tous les Jours and go down the hallway. The back parking is for compact cars only and is at a severe downhill.
Great vibes! Connected with bakery, good snacks, good prices, cute cups and happy smiles!!! :3
Great atmosphere. Great customer service. Very knowledgeable about products sold.
The mangolicious with a milk cap is a little piece of heaven.
Best boba tea
Very strong tea flavor and not too sweet with classic flavors. Good bouncy chewiness boba texture
The BEST boba tea in CLT!!

i was in the area and i was craving some boba so i stopped here, i think this place is new and its great!! friendly staff , cute atmosphere, and yummy drinks. they also have other desserts like rolled ice cream and macaroons . This would also be a great place to study as well plus it’s connected to a Tous Les Jour!
Cute area in the back of the complex. Large selection of drinks. Cozy environment with many outlets. Parking is limited in the back. But tasty drinks, will be back!
Best boba in Charlotte!

I saw this was a new boba shop in South End and went to visit. Little did I know it was attached to Tous Le Jours! If you park in the front of the building, just walk through the bakery to the back. Better yet, get a little treat from each shop while you visit :) There is also a separate back entrance with some parking. The staff is very accommodating and kind. You get a few dollars off for your first order/signing up for the loyalty program! They have a menu with lots of variety. Will definitely come back to try more flavors.
Excellent place, lots of variety in the flavors, rolled ice cream, connected to the pastry shop on the other side. Real great place

It’s so good!!
A boba tea shop approved by Taiwanese..😄

Parking It’s a little small and like up hill but the drinks are not bad. The bobas are soft, warm, sweet and chewy. It also leads to a bakery which has very delicious treats. Is a great place to get a drink and treats at the same time. All you have to do and walk straight. They also have restrooms. I really like this place. I have only tried the Jasmine milk tea and it’s delicious 🤤.
great Chinese style milk tea!
Awesomely fruity bubble tea. Great variety too. I'm determined to try them all.

Best boba/bubble tea in Charlotte, and it's not even close. The space is in the back of Tous Les Jours and you can access it either by walking through TLJ or from the back entrance. I've had the ube taro drink multiple times now, and they use REAL ingredients for so much if not all of their drinks! The ube taro drink had ube halaya, for example, and you can see them slicing fruits in the back often. My lychee jade tea drink also had cut up lychee also floating around!

My friends who are also Asian transplants from big cities all agree this place is super good. For me, it's among the best boba drinks I've ever had, even on the west coast! I will be going out of my way for this place often

This felt like a hidden gem. If you park off of South Blvd, you walk into a bakery. Yet, you are guided down the shared walkway with bathrooms to this place. The decor is very nice and there are plenty of seating options.
They have a wide variety of drinks and sweets like macarons and rolled ice cream. Seriously, the menu has something for every sweet tooth. Now, I'm a sucker for anything, Ube, so I order the Ube meets Taro Milk Cap Drink. I added lychee jelly as my topping. The milk cap caught me off guard as it was a bite salty. The owner did say they had to make it fresh as they ran out right before we got there. Otherwise, everything was great. The owner even offered my son some gummy bears to hold him over.
I would recommend minus the milk cap at least for me next time.

I love boba, so I was excited for this Yelp opportunity to try a new place!

Not the easiest to find, and I got there by going through Tour de Jours but once I was there, I was greeted warmly. The space was cute and clean.

The menu has a large variety of milk and tea-based flavors and also some desserts! I'm not a tea or milk drinker and typically go for slushes or smoothies, but ended going with the mango lemonade and strawberry lemonade (which include non caffeinated tea). I appreciated that I could confirm I wanted to include boba as well as the standard amount of sweetness and took them both home in a convenient bag.

Not only were the drinks pretty to look at but they were also delicious! Super fresh and luckily for me, I couldn't taste the tea at all lol. I wonder if it'd be easy enough to create smoothie versions of the same drinks by substituting tea with ice. Excited to come back and try some of the desserts next time!

My wife and I visited SipCha and it was amazing! We have tried various boba shops within Charlotte, but SipCha’s tasted really good. We both enjoyed our drinks and the customer service was really good and the people working were really kind to us. We got the strawberry milk tea with boba and the brown sugar milk tea with boba. We highly recommend SipCha! We can’t wait to visit again to try more!

They are located right behind Tous Les Jours in the same building. You can enter thru Tous and walk down the hallway to get to SipCha or you can take the back entrance from the back parking lot there.

This is definitely a cute little quaint place & I'm here for it! First and foremost, this is located in Southend, right behind the Tours les jours bakery. It's all connected. SipCha does have its own entrance located in the back with more parking spaces rather than the front of the building right off South Blvd.  I was greeted immediately and warmly by the cashier (failed to get her name) and was given great recommendations and explained everything in detail. I tried out their seasonal Watermelon Slush, which came with Milk Cap.  The juice itself was SUPER REFRESHING on a hot summer day as today. It was not so sweet. Now, unfortunately, I did not like the Milk Cap foam AT ALL! it literally tasted like sea water to me. It was so salty. Thankfully, the foam did not mix into my drink, so I was able to drink the juice and avoid the foam. Other than that, it was delicious! I will definitely be returning to try other drinks and some of their pastries.

There’s nothing better than a cold, sweet drink on a hot summer day. The Strawberry Shortcake was amazing. It came in a pre-frozen cup with a drizzle on the inside which was so cool (no pun intended). I got it with less sugar and added crystal boba. It was the perfect non caffeinated drink for me.

I'm not a huge fan of bubble tea, but I haven't had any in a while, so when I saw this pop up on the list of Yelp events I had to jump at it.  I have never done any yelp related activities in Charlotte, so I was very excited to see if they are anything like the ones in Atlanta.
Sipcha was a little difficult to find, but it just opened up, so I'm sure my GPS was doing the best it could.  It is attached to the Tous Le Jour and it is really nice, the decor that was present throughout was great, I love the fact that it was intimate but at the same time there were plenty of seats for people.
Service was good, I was like a deer in headlights looking at the menu, and they were very patient with me. I had a million questions about the different drinks and toppings and what goes with what, lol.  I'm sure I got on their nerves, but they took good care of me.
I had the Dragon in a Bottle, Green Pomegranate to drink, and to eat I chose the Mango Cloud.  The highlight of the trip was definitely the mango cloud. It was full of flavor, but it was sooooooo tiny! I enjoyed both drinks; I added tapioca and blueberry popping to my Dragon in a bottle. It was such a chill environment, I would definitely go there to get a drink and do some work or meet up with friends!

Super cute boba tea shop in Southend. I parked in the front and walked through the bakery but they also have their own parking lot in the back. I ordered the blue Hawaiian (Citrus Punch, Yakult and Green Tea). It’s a sweet drink but it’s very tasty. Their boba is super fresh and had the perfect combination of being both soft and chewy. They have a menu on the wall but there is also a tablet where you can order online. They have a loyalty program and I believe its $2 off your first drink when you sign up.

We got a jasmine milk tea with honey, rose tea, orchid oolong, lychee jade, & so much passion tea. The strawberry cheese waffle decadent and fresh. The rose and jasmine were the favorites. Also, Zoriana was so helpful and kind! It was a bit hard to find the place but so worth it! Definitely will be back!!
Great customer service! The rolled ice cream was delicious! I was given a great recommendation for the mango tea, and it was delicious, with lots of real mango pieces.
Environment is cozy and selections of beverages amazing! I purchased the Mango Lemonade! Very delicious!
Great!
High quality tea on same level as in China
Ube meets Taro is my new favorite!!
